title: Do the Bruins have a potential breakout prospect in camp in Dans Locmelis?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Dans Locmelis, a Bruins prospect, excelled in the 2025 IIHF World Championships with four goals and six points over seven games.
Locmelis signed an entry-level deal with Boston, impressing in Providence with 12 points over six playoff games.
The 21-year-old demonstrates strong hockey sense and creativity, participating in the 2025 Prospects Challenge in Buffalo.

title: Rob Gronkowski: Patriots QB Drake Maye looked ‘timid’ against Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rob Gronkowski criticized Patriots QB Drake Maye for his timid performance in their 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
Drake Maye completed 14 of 20 passes for 150 yards and a touchdown but struggled after halftime.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel and QB Maye faced scrutiny over the complex Josh McDaniels’ offense.

title: Braintree man dies weeks after being struck by e-bike in Copley Square
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Minh Dang, 64, of Braintree, died after being struck by an e-bike in Copley Square last month.
The incident occurred on August 6 near Huntington Avenue and Dartmouth Street, Boston, resulting in life-threatening injuries.
The e-bike operator, who stayed at the scene, has not been publicly identified and faces no charges yet.

title: Watch out for the ‘wicked high’ king tides this week at Boston Harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: King tides, known as perigean spring tides, are occurring this fall in Boston Harbor due to the moon's orbit and phases.
The Stone Living Lab and National Park Service offer events and walking tours to witness the tides along Boston's coastline.
These tides cause ocean levels to rise two to four feet higher than normal, with specific dates available through December.

title: Stefon Diggs says Drake Maye isn’t a ‘softie’ when it comes to criticism
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stefon Diggs supports Patriots QB Drake Maye, stating he's tough and can handle criticism after a loss to Raiders.
Drake Maye completed 30-of-46 passes for 287 yards, with one touchdown and one interception against the Raiders.
Stefon Diggs debuted for the Patriots with six catches for 57 yards in the season opener against Las Vegas.

title: Audit: K-12 school department failed to investigate 22 child abuse reports
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Audit finds DESE failed to investigate 22 supported child abuse reports between February 2020 and July 2023.
DESE also delayed resolutions on special education complaints, averaging a 111-day delay beyond the required 60-day timeframe.
Audit criticizes DESE for not fulfilling responsibilities related to LGBTQ issues, including lacking annual school materials distribution.

title: ‘Nothing short of horrific’: Mass. politicians react to fatal shooting of Charlie Kirk
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk was fatally shot during a political event at Utah Valley University on Wednesday.
Massachusetts politicians, including Gov. Maura Healey and Sen. Elizabeth Warren, condemned the shooting and political violence.
Authorities have not identified a suspect but confirmed one arrest was made and later released after questioning.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez not practicing, along with 2 key vets
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Christian Gonzalez remains sidelined with a hamstring injury, missing Patriots practice since July 28.
Harold Landry and Morgan Moses also missed Patriots practice with foot injuries ahead of the Dolphins game.
The potential absence of Gonzalez is a concern as Patriots face Miami's Tyreek Hill and Jaylen Waddle.

title: Drake Maye talks starting fast, capitalizing in the red zone, and the throws he wished he had back
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Drake Maye expressed regret over rushed throws in the Patriots' season-opening loss to the Raiders.
The Patriots struggled in the red zone, going 1-for-3, while the Raiders converted their sole opportunity.
Maye completed 30 of 46 passes for 287 yards and highlighted the need to start games faster.

title: What Celtics star Jaylen Brown said about potentially playing for hometown team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jaylen Brown has four years remaining on his Celtics contract and has been linked to trade rumors despite a strong role.
Brown expressed potential interest in playing for his hometown Atlanta Hawks during a radio interview in Georgia.
With Jayson Tatum injured, Brown is set to assume a more prominent role for the retooled Boston Celtics team.
